CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 13, 1951, pg. 6, reads: "Public School Art Contest Judges, Winners - The fourth annual art contest held in Pittsburgh public schools and sponsored by the B'nai B'rith Women's Council of Greater Pittsburgh has been completed, and the winning illustrations have been selected at the Board of Education Building by a jury consisting of Othmar von Fuerher of Carnegie Museum, Perry Davis of Carnegie Tech, Mrs. Mary Shaw Marohnic of the Simboli Art School, and Mrs. Nathan Holstein, past president of the B'nai B'rith Women's Council. The theme this year, 'One Nation Indivisible,' aims to demonstrate the unity that exists among the variety of people who make up our great population in America.  Winning youngsters shown with their illustrations are " Betty Schmitt, first prize for senior hight schools; Tommy Yee, first prize for junior high schools; Clark D. Neil, second prize for senior high schools, and Raymond Saunders, third prize for senior high schools. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of winners of art contest sponsored by B'nai B'rith Women's Council, from left: Betty Schmitt, Tommy Yee, Clark D. Neil, and Raymond Saunders holding paintings in Pittsburgh Board of Education building, another version
